text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-AllergyIntolerance.reaction

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*Extension(4.0.1)Adverse Reaction Events linked to exposure to substance
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:substance 0..1ExtensionSpecific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptSpecific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-substance-code-for-R4 (example): Codes defining the type of the substance (including pharmaceutical products).
extension:manifestation 1..*ExtensionClinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:_datatype 1..1ExtensionDataType slice for a FHIR R5 `CodeableReference` value
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/_datatype"
value[x] 1..1stringValue of extension
Fixed Value: CodeableReference
extension:concept 0..1ExtensionReference to a concept (by class)
url 1..1uri"concept"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptReference to a concept (by class)
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-clinical-findings-for-R4 (preferred)
extension:reference 0..1ExtensionReference to a resource (by instance)
url 1..1uri"reference"
value[x] 0..1Reference(Cross-version Profile for R5.Observation for use in FHIR R4(0.0.1-snapshot-3) | Observation)Reference to a resource (by instance)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-AllergyIntolerance.reaction.manifestation"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension
extension:description 0..1ExtensionDescription of the event as a whole
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-AllergyIntolerance.reaction.description"
value[x] 0..1stringDescription of the event as a whole
extension:onset 0..1ExtensionDate(/time) when manifestations showed
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-AllergyIntolerance.reaction.onset"
value[x] 0..1dateTimeDate(/time) when manifestations showed
extension:severity 0..1Extensionmild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-AllergyIntolerance.reaction.severity"
value[x] 0..1codemild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole)
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-reaction-event-severity-for-R4 (required): Clinical assessment of the severity of a reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.
extension:exposureRoute 0..1ExtensionHow the subject was exposed to the substance
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-AllergyIntolerance.reaction.exposureRoute"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptHow the subject was exposed to the substance
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-route-codes-for-R4 (example): A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of exposure to a substance.
extension:note 0..*ExtensionText about event not captured in other fields
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-AllergyIntolerance.reaction.note"
value[x] 0..1AnnotationText about event not captured in other fields
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-AllergyIntolerance.reaction"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionAllergyIntolerance_Reaction
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.AllergyIntolerance.reaction` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`AllergyIntolerance.reaction` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Adverse Reaction Events linked to exposure to substance
element.definition: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified substance.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Extension
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
element.definition: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.  If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.
element.comment: Coding of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) with a terminology capable of triggering decision support should be used wherever possible.  The 'code' element allows for the use of a specific substance or pharmaceutical product, or a group or class of substances. In the case of an allergy or intolerance to a class of substances, (for example, "penicillins"), the 'reaction.substance' element could be used to code the specific substance that was identified as having caused the reaction (for example, "amoxycillin"). Duplication of the value in the 'code' and 'reaction.substance' elements is acceptable when a specific substance has been recorded in 'code'.
element.requirements:
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance` is part of an existing definition because parent element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance`, but has no comparisons.

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.short: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
element.definition: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.  If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.
element.comment: Coding of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) with a terminology capable of triggering decision support should be used wherever possible.  The 'code' element allows for the use of a specific substance or pharmaceutical product, or a group or class of substances. In the case of an allergy or intolerance to a class of substances, (for example, "penicillins"), the 'reaction.substance' element could be used to code the specific substance that was identified as having caused the reaction (for example, "amoxycillin"). Duplication of the value in the 'code' and 'reaction.substance' elements is acceptable when a specific substance has been recorded in 'code'.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes defining the type of the substance (including pharmaceutical products).

element.short: Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event
element.definition: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event.
element.comment: Manifestation can be expressed as a single word, phrase or brief description. For example: nausea, rash or no reaction. It is preferable that manifestation should be coded with a terminology, where possible. The values entered here may be used to display on an application screen as part of a list of adverse reactions, as recommended in the UK NHS CUI guidelines.  Terminologies commonly used include, but are not limited to, SNOMED CT or ICD10.

element.short: Description of the event as a whole
element.definition: Text description about the reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.
element.comment: Use the description to provide any details of a particular event of the occurred reaction such as circumstances, reaction specifics, what happened before/after. Information, related to the event, but not describing a particular care should be captured in the note field. For example: at the age of four, the patient was given penicillin for strep throat and subsequently developed severe hives.

element.short: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
element.definition: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.  If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.
element.comment: Coding of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) with a terminology capable of triggering decision support should be used wherever possible.  The 'code' element allows for the use of a specific substance or pharmaceutical product, or a group or class of substances. In the case of an allergy or intolerance to a class of substances, (for example, "penicillins"), the 'reaction.substance' element could be used to code the specific substance that was identified as having caused the reaction (for example, "amoxycillin"). Duplication of the value in the 'code' and 'reaction.substance' elements is acceptable when a specific substance has been recorded in 'code'.
element.requirements:
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance` is part of an existing definition because parent element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event

Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.  If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.
element.comment: Coding of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) with a terminology capable of triggering decision support should be used wherever possible.  The 'code' element allows for the use of a specific substance or pharmaceutical product, or a group or class of substances. In the case of an allergy or intolerance to a class of substances, (for example, "penicillins"), the 'reaction.substance' element could be used to code the specific substance that was identified as having caused the reaction (for example, "amoxycillin"). Duplication of the value in the 'code' and 'reaction.substance' elements is acceptable when a specific substance has been recorded in 'code'.

binding.description: Codes defining the type of the substance (including pharmaceutical products).

element.short: Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event
element.definition: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event.
element.comment: Manifestation can be expressed as a single word, phrase or brief description. For example: nausea, rash or no reaction. It is preferable that manifestation should be coded with a terminology, where possible. The values entered here may be used to display on an application screen as part of a list of adverse reactions, as recommended in the UK NHS CUI guidelines.  Terminologies commonly used include, but are not limited to, SNOMED CT or ICD10.
element.requirements:
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.manifestation` is part of an existing definition because parent element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.manifestation` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.manifestation`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: DataType slice for a FHIR R5 `CodeableReference` value
element.definition: Slice to indicate the presence of a R5 `CodeableReference` in FHIR R4

element.comment: Must be: CodeableReference

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.
element.requirements:
Element `CodeableReference.concept` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `CodeableConcept`, but has no comparisons.
Element `CodeableReference.concept` has a context of Reference based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Reference`.

element.short: Reference to a concept (by class)
element.definition: A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

element.short: Reference to a resource (by instance)
element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.
element.requirements:
Element `CodeableReference.reference` has a context of CodeableConcept based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `CodeableConcept`.
Element `CodeableReference.reference` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Reference`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Reference to a resource (by instance)
element.definition: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

element.short: Description of the event as a whole
element.definition: Text description about the reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.
element.comment: Use the description to provide any details of a particular event of the occurred reaction such as circumstances, reaction specifics, what happened before/after. Information, related to the event, but not describing a particular care should be captured in the note field. For example: at the age of four, the patient was given penicillin for strep throat and subsequently developed severe hives.
element.requirements:
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.description` is part of an existing definition because parent element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.description` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.description`, but has no comparisons.

element.comment: Use the description to provide any details of a particular event of the occurred reaction such as circumstances, reaction specifics, what happened before/after. Information, related to the event, but not describing a particular care should be captured in the note field. For example: at the age of four, the patient was given penicillin for strep throat and subsequently developed severe hives.

element.short: Date(/time) when manifestations showed
element.definition: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the Reaction.
element.requirements:
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.onset` is part of an existing definition because parent element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.onset` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.onset`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Date(/time) when manifestations showed
element.definition: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the Reaction.

element.short: mild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole)
element.definition: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.
element.comment: It is acknowledged that this assessment is very subjective. There may be some specific practice domains where objective scales have been applied. Objective scales can be included in this model as extensions.
element.requirements:
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.severity` is part of an existing definition because parent element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.severity` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.severity`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: mild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole)
element.definition: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.
element.comment: It is acknowledged that this assessment is very subjective. There may be some specific practice domains where objective scales have been applied. Objective scales can be included in this model as extensions.

binding.description: Clinical assessment of the severity of a reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

element.short: How the subject was exposed to the substance
element.definition: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.
element.comment: Coding of the route of exposure with a terminology should be used wherever possible.
element.requirements:
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.exposureRoute` is part of an existing definition because parent element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.exposureRoute` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AllergyIntolerance.reaction.exposureRoute`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: How the subject was exposed to the substance
element.definition: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.
element.comment: Coding of the route of exposure with a terminology should be used wherever possible.

binding.description: A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of exposure to a substance.

element.short: Text about event not captured in other fields
element.definition: Additional text about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.
element.comment: Use this field to record information indirectly related to a particular event and not captured in the description. For example: Clinical records are no longer available, recorded based on information provided to the patient by her mother and her mother is deceased.
element.requirements:
